title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: A Palestinian convicted in bombing plot is now an award-winning novelist, and free
items.description: Bassem Khandaqji entered prison 21 years ago for plotting a deadly bombing in Israel. He left prison as an award-winning novelist.

items.title: Dems seek to limit who can be immigration judges. And, the GOP wins House election

items.title: Storm Floodwaters in Indonesia Turned Logs Into Floating Projectiles
items.description: Many logs became forces of destruction in Indonesia last week, in a sign that deforestation compounded the devastation wrought by a cyclone.

items.title: The G.O.P. Continues to Slip
items.description: Almost every election night this year has gone poorly for Republicans — a familiar position for the party that occupies the White House.

items.title: One year on from martial law crisis, South Korea celebrates its democracy's resilience
items.description: One year on from failed presidential power grab, South Korea celebrates its resilient democracy, and tries to heal deep political divisions.

items.title: 50 years after the birth of special education, some fear for its future under Trump
items.description: The Trump administration has fired, or tried to fire, many of the federal staff who manage and enforce federal disability law in schools.
